New Records: The White Sox are closing in on the post-1900 record for losses â€” 120 by the 1962 New York Mets in their inaugural season.
Key Match Events: Lane Thomas hit a three-run homer and scored on Kyle Manzardo's second-inning single
Ben Lively departed with a leg injury after being hit by a liner in the second inning
Cleveland's bullpen combined for seven innings of four-hit ball after Lively departed
Pre-Game Insights: Analysts predicted a close game between the two rival teams
The manager emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance
Post-Match Reflections: Stephen Vogt praised his relievers for stepping up in a huge way and being efficient
Grady Sizemore acknowledged that the White Sox had some good swings, but couldn't get the big hit
Miscellaneous Highlights: Lane Thomas was acquired in a July 29 trade with Washington and is batting.364 with three homers and nine RBIs in September
The Guardians' bullpen has a 37-11 record and a major league-best 2.76 ERA
Jonathan Cannon was charged with three runs and seven hits in 5 1/3 innings
Sean Burke pitched three innings in his major league debut and allowed one run and three hits
Others: Alex Cobb is throwing weighted balls and the team is going day to day with the pitcher
Sam Hentges is going to have shoulder surgery on Sept. 18 and is expected to be sidelined for about a year
Drew Thorpe said his season-ending elbow surgery went as expected and he should have a normal offseason and be ready to go for next year
